intro: Erysimum maderense, commonly known as the Mader's wallflower, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in rocky or limestone soils. The plant produces bright yellow flowers with four petals, which bloom in early spring. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Erysimum maderense is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, thriving in cool, sunny environments.
